summary: The Rescissions Act of 2025 proposes to rescind specific amounts of unobligated budget authority. The bill targets funds allocated in the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 2024 and the Full-Year Continuing Appropriations Act of 2025. Rescissions impact various areas including international organizations, global health programs, migration and refugee assistance, complex crises funds, democracy programs, economic support, international financial institutions, development assistance, and other foreign aid initiatives. It also rescinds funds for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in 2026 and 2027.
